position.marginalia_text: Istius Thoma[e] Smithi reformata[e] Orthographia[e] Eccè honorifica sa[e]pè mentio in Baretti alueario Anglico, Latino, Gra[e]co, Francico. In literis A: H: S: Smitho de Orthographia contra Cacographiam Secundus, in suo alphabeto Barettus. Nec verò contemnendus de Orthographia Chesterus, ille etiam polyglottus. Adhuc tamen pla[e]riq[ue] veterani cum Consuetudine delirant: et illum vetulum abusum etiamnum obseruant, qui etsi non est ex vsu, in vsu tamen est.

book.title: De recta & emendata linguae anglicae scriptione dialogus

marginalia.translation: See the often honorific mention of this Thomas Smith's reformed spelling, made in Barettus's 'Apiary' of English, Latin, Greek and French. In the letters A, H, and S. In his alphabet, Barettus follows Smith on spelling against ugly writing. In fact, Chester on spelling is not to be scorned; he is, after all, a polyglot. At present, however, many of the old authors are used to deviating from the right path, and observe the old abuses, which though not derived from use, are yet in use.
